meanings.definition: To put a saddle back on a horse.
meanings.sent1: After the ride, I need to resaddle the horse before putting it back in the stable.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy had to resaddle his horse after it had run off with the saddle.
meanings.sent3: Trying to resaddle a feisty horse can be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: She felt like she needed to resaddle her life after a series of setbacks.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cowboy resaddling his horse stayed with her for days.

meanings.definition: To adjust or readjust a saddle on a horse.
meanings.sent1: He had to resaddle the horse multiple times to find the right fit.
meanings.sent2: The rider had to resaddle the horse as it kept slipping to the side.
meanings.sent3: The horse seemed to enjoy making the rider resaddle it repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: She had to resaddle her emotions before facing the difficult conversation.
meanings.sent5: The act of resaddling the horse became second nature to the experienced rider.
